description: Borrowed from Middle French caruncule, from Latin caruncula (“a little piece of flesh”), diminutive of carō (“flesh”). Doublet of caruncula.

entries.meaning: (anatomy, zootomy) A small, fleshy excrescence that is a normal part of an animal's anatomy.
examples: Coordinate terms: comb, cockscomb, crest, snood, wattle

entries.meaning: (anatomy) Clipping of lacrimal caruncle: the red prominence at the inner corner of the eye.
(botany) A colored waxy or oily outgrowth near the micropyle of some seeds, attractive to ants which aid the seed's dispersal.
